results.title: Broken English (A)
results.creator_credit: Ned Lander, Rachel Perkins and City Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blood brothers (A)”.
In 1958, as a result of a forced confession, an inability to read or write English and the racial intolerance of the police and the community of the time, Rupert Max Stuart, an itinerant, half-caste Aborigine, was sentenced to hang for the rape and murder of a nine year old girl. Using dramatisation, archival film and interviews with those involved, including Stuart himself, this video charts the trial, appeals and subsequent attempts to overthrow the conviction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ned Lander, Rachel Perkins and City Pictures

results.title: Broken down bus
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: An old bus lies decaying in a yard, rendered obsolete by a fleet of modern coaches. But the bus is sold and after much restoration finds new life in a kindergarten playground. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Broken China: the earthquake that never happened
results.creator_credit: Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Liu Chun, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Zhao Shujing, Chen Meng, Yuan Zhengming, ABC-TV (Australia), Southern Star Entertainment and CCTV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Dragon stirs”.
Part one of a four part series about China. On 28 July 1976 a natural disaster - the worst ever recorded in China - killed over a quarter million people in the industrial city of Tang Shang, just 100km east of Beijing. An earthquake of massive proportions ripped the city apart destroying 96% of its buildings and burying alive over 600,000 people, all within 53 seconds. Fearing political unrest with the imminent death of Chairman Mao, the Chinese Government kept the extent of the disaster a State secret rejecting international offers of help preferring instead to send in thousands of their own soldiers from the People’s Liberation Army. This documentary records the amazing effort by the soldiers and the people of Tang Shang to rebuild their city in the aftermath of the earthquake. Through personal interviews by survivors and their stories of heroic acts, miracles, and tragedies, the film provides an insight into the spirit, unity and courage of these people who 20 years on still carry the memories and emotional scars. It is a heart-warming story of humans co-operating together as one in the most adverse of circumstances. Contains b&w archival footage. Narrated by Peter George and Diana McLean. In Mandarin with English subtitles and commentary in English.
results.title_for_label: Broken China: the earthquake that never happened
results.creator_credit_for_label: Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Liu Chun, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Zhao Shujing, Chen Meng, Yuan Zhengming, ABC-TV (Australia), Southern Star Entertainment and CCTV

results.title: Broken Bones
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Function of bones. How bones can be broken. The signs and symptoms of broken bones and the emergency treatment required. Using an example of a broken bone caused by a direct force the necessary first aid steps are highlighted.

results.title: Broken blossoms [DVD]
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A young Chinese man, disillusioned by life in London, shelters the daughter of a brutish prize fighter, whom he has adored at a distance. Her father, alerted by an informer, comes after them. This is a deceptively simple chamber piece (most of it takes place in two interior sets) in contrast to the epic scale of Intolerance and Birth of a Nation. Griffith’s ties with Victorian theatre and literature were blended with the visual resources of the cinema in a new lyrically intense romanticism, the perfect context for Gish’s unforgettable portrayal of quiet vulnerability complemented by Barthelmess’s gentle emotionalism. Tinted version with musical soundtrack. Cast: Lillian Gish, Richard Barthelmess, Donald Crisp.

results.title: Broken arrow = Blood brothers
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Julian Blaustein and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1870 white men and Indians are still fighting bitterly. One man, Tom Jeffords (James Stewart), is the lonely voice of conscience on the frontier, and strongly believes the Apaches are being treated unfairly. He befriends their leader Cochise (Jeff Chandler), and the two become friends as they forge negotiations to reach a truce. During this process Jeffords is called upon by a U.S. Army general to negotiate a government peace treaty, which he does successfully. The treaty comes at a high price however, when Jeffords, his Indian wife, and friend Cochise become targets of a renegade ambush. Based on the novel “Blood brother” by Elliott Arnold. Cast includes James Stewart, Jeff Chandler, Debra Paget and Basil Ruysdael.

images.caption: Broken arrow = Blood brothers (Delmer Daves) still

results.title: Broken appointment
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Irving Jacoby, Mental Health Film Board and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: Shows the development of a young public health nurse to a mature realization of the importance of human contact between the professional and the patient and an understanding that emotional difficulties can interfere with physical welfare. The film describes the experience of a public health nurse who is attached to a baby health clinic. During the course of her work, the nurse helps a young mother to overcome the fears and worries associated with childbirth.

results.title: Broiling
results.brief_description: Demonstrates proper broiling procedures for meats, fish, and poultry, Shows how to mark meats, tests for doneness, turn without piercing, prevent sticking, coordinate with servers, and care for equipment.

results.title: Broadway melody of 1938
results.creator_credit: Roy Del Ruth, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Robert Taylor plays Steve Raleigh, a Broadway producer who wants to put on a show called Broadway Melody. Eleanor Powell plays Sally Lee, the girl Steve loves who owns a racehorse which must win the big event to finance the show. Sensational dancing is the highlight of this musical as well as Judy Garland’s very first appearance in an MGM musical performing her first big hit - ‘Dear Mr. Gable (You Made Me Love You)’ - a superb show-stopper.

results.title: Broadway Danny Rose. Tennis elbow
results.creator_credit: John Thomson, Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Set in the fast-paced world of small-time entertainers looking for the “big break”, “Broadway Danny Rose” is a delightful comedy celebrating the Italian and Jewish roots to the American theatrical tradition. Woody Allen is a struggling manager trying to boost the careers of an eccentric range of comic performers (including balloon “sculptors” and singing and dancing psychics). He becomes involved with protecting the girlfriend (Mia Farrow) of one of his “artists” who is running from the Mafia. Though set in contemporary New York, Gordon Willis’ painterly black and white cinematography evokes the romantic Broadway of the jazz age. The video also includes the Australian student short, “Tennis Elbow”, an anarchic comedy about making movies, playing tennis and dope-smoking policemen.
